intro: Bidens biternata var. biternata, commonly known as the three-parted beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with three distinct lobes, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and roadside areas.
